newsitem.title: MEXICO: Nadro to eliminate A series shares.
newsitem.headline: Nadro to eliminate A series shares.

text.p: Pharmaceutical company Nadro will eliminate its A series shares on October 4, and convert them into series B shares, the company said on Wednesday.
The shares will be exchanged on a one-for-one basis, as agreed at a shareholders' meeting held June 18, Nadro said in a report to the Mexican Stock Exchange.
A total of 100,120,740 A series shares will thus up the number of B series shares to 147,236,370, Nadro said.
After the exchange, B series shares will have a price of 24.524412 pesos, calculated from average prices of the two series over the past six months, weighted according to amounts traded.
